name: H10 Lanzarote Princess

reviews.text: The H10 Lanzarote Princess is a fantastic hotel with all of the amenaties you need in a hotel. On arrival to the hotel, you are immediatly greeted with the hotel staff to help with your luggage, check-in is quick and easy. You are then shown to your room. The rooms were fully refurbushed to a very high standard. The hotel staff are all very friendly and helpfull, the groundsmen are always out looking after the hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic, NO.1 Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do not believe any bad reviews, people are too harsh and are always looking for the smallest things.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel but short on staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You are just 2 minutes walk from the beach and 5 minutes away from the main resort of Playa Blanca. There is a shop inside the hotel for all of your needs.
reviews.title: We had a lovely holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You will love the hotel and playa blanca, lanzarote is a fantastic island and I think the H10 Lanzarote Princess is the best hotel you will find. Enjoy your stay!
reviews.title: Good value but dont expect 4 star throughout

reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for 7 days on an AI basis and our allocated room was a 'refurbished' one overlooking the pool, very nice. The hotel has a spacious sun lounging area around the pool with plenty of sunbeds.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel! Something for everyone!

reviews.text: Well it was our second time to the lanzarote princess.
reviews.title: Better than the first time

reviews.text: We had a fantastic time ... First he slight negatives:
reviews.title: Good value, well located

reviews.text: Had to put towels out very early if you wanted a sun lounger .
reviews.title: "Hotel Going Downhill"l

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food was fantastic , just lacking bit of better choice for younger kids . As our son got bit fed up of pasta dishes!!
reviews.title: Relaxed atmosphere and good food if a bit understaffed

reviews.text: Adults not allowed to take kids on slide on pirate ship..
reviews.title: not as good as expected
Decent hotel for a week in the sun
reviews.text: Nice room with a good view, good service. nice relaxing week with the wife.

reviews.title: Definitley would go back again!
reviews.text: Loved this hotel. the staff were friendly, food was great, very clean, entertainment good fun including the mini disco. Close to the town if you fancied a stroll. You do have to hire a kettle and a fridge if you want one, we opted for the kettle only

reviews.title: Fantastic return visit to 'The Princess'
reviews.text: Just returned from 2-week family holiday with two teenagers, and we were not disappointed that we chose to return to this lovely hotel, having had a 5 year break. This was our fourth visit to this hotel and have to say that it is still as welcoming as ever.

reviews.title: What a great holiday
reviews.text: The staff were all very friendly and keen to ensure that we had a good holiday.

reviews.title: Spacious, comfy & ideal for families
reviews.text: Special mention must be made to the fantastic entertainment team, who worked so hard to get to know and include all who wanted to get involved, Led by Walter, who has to be the most professional and dedicated entertainer we have ever had the pleasure to meet who worked so hard with his team, who were always professional and enthusiastic.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I returned yesterday after spending two enjoyable weeks at this hotel on an all inclusive basis which we thought was well worth the extra charge. We are a well travelled pair of wrinklies
reviews.title: Be Open Minded and Enjoy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel reception is a large open area with the entertainment and piano lounge situated at each side. There is a sweeping staircase leading to the lower ground level, restaurant and pool area. We were allocated room 1074 which was a refurbished room but had two steps from the bath area down to the bedroom. These proved to be dangerous especially in the middle of the night. We requested a move which was sorted the next day. The hotel is quite worn in places but is kept very clean. The restaurant area is more akin to a busy cafeteria with the waiters struggling to clear off the tables at busy times which causes queueing. In the mornings it is common for there to be no cups. There are two drinks dispensing areas but some of the machines were never on during our stay which again caused queueing. The food and variety was generally good both in the restaurant and pool snack bar, if you be a bit adventuress you will be suprised at some of the dishes. There is a large free form pool with plenty of loungers, if youre not bothered about getting up in the morning to bag the best positions there is always somewhere to plonk yourself later on. There is a childrens pool with a galleon and water slide plus a play area. The evening entertainment was a mixture of the animation team and profesional artists and was quite enjoyable. We found all the staff at the hotel to be hard working and pleasant at all times. The hotel is in a very good position about 300 m down to the beach. A 15 minute walk to the Rubicon Marina, 20 minute walk to the port and 10 minute walk to the start of the main pedestrianised shopping area. Overall we would consider this hotel to be more of a 3 star, but would certainly return again. We thought the resort was very pleasant whith a nice mixture of bars and restaurants. We went to fuerteventura on the small ferry (20 euros each) but didnt think it was worth going. Car hire is reasonable and there are plenty of organized trips arround the island.
reviews.title: superb holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After spending a week at the Lanzarote Princess,I cannot believe some of the reviews on here.If you look hard enough you will always find fault.From the moment we arrived to the day of leaving we were over the moon with the service provided at this hotel. Those who cannot find anything suitable to eat here I suggest they pay 5 star or stay at home.location is excellent for those like us who like to get out and about, and having spoken to a few who were all inclusive they were more than happy staying round the hotel pool which was kept spotless.playa blanca is lovely and is a nice walk at night along the well lit promenade.our room was clean tidy, nice flatscreen tv ,power shower, towels changed ,room cleaned daily all in all great value for money.dont let the moaners put you off,give it a go.
reviews.title: Never a 4 star - maybe in 1995 it was.....

reviews.text: My partner and I arrived at the Lanzarote Princess and were immediately very disappointed. The reception was shabby and the bar looks like something out of Dynasty very 80s/90s the whole place desperately needs refurbished.
reviews.title: A very good holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was damp y0ou could smell it when you took anything out of the wardrobe, my partner slept on top of the covers each night fully clothed and didn't unpack his case, yes it was that bad,
reviews.title: Ideal situation and friendly atmosphere.

aka: h10 Lanzarote Princess Hotel Playa Blanca
